did.unittitle: Chinese Cultural Revolution collection
did.abstract: Newspaper issues, pamphlets, broadsides, flyers, and sound recordings, issued by Red Guards, relating to the Chinese Cultural Revolution.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of some sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Chinese Cultural Revolution collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2007, with increments received in 2015 and 2017.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Newspaper issues, pamphlets, broadsides, flyers, and sound recordings, issued by Red Guards, relating to the Chinese Cultural Revolution.

An increment received in 2015 contains documents relating to revolutionary activities in the Beijing and Shanghai areas and Mao Zedong’s directives to party members and the Red Guards against his political rivals, notably the former chairman of the People’s Republic, Liu Shaoqi, and Liu’s wife, Wang Guangmei.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Songs by the Peasants' Amateur Cultural Team of Hopei Province
Poor and Lower-Middle Peasants Love Chairman Mao Most

Side 1: 1. Poor and Lower-Middle Peasants Love Chairman Mao Most (Female Voice in Unison) 2. Chairman Mao Puts on His Olive-Green Uniform (Female Voice in Unison) 3. Look at the Well-Grown Crops of Our Team (Male Singing with Acting) 4. We'll Catch Up with Tachai with Great Determination (Female Voice in Unison) 5. Conquer Nature and be Its Master (Female Singing with Acting)

Side 2: 1. Mao Tse-Tung's Thought Illuminates Our Village (Female Solo) 2. Girls in Our Village are Really Capable (Female Voice in Unison) 3. Eight Sisters-in-Law Take Part in the Spring Ploughing (Female Singing with Acting) 4. We Grow Cotton for the Revolution (Female Singing with Acting) 5. We Are Both Peasants and Militiamen (Song and Dance)

2015 incremental materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The 2015 incremental materials contain documents relating to revolutionary activities in the Beijing and Shanghai areas and Mao Zedong’s directives to party members and the Red Guards against his political rivals, notably the former chairman of the People’s Republic, Liu Shaoqi, and Liu’s wife, Wang Guangmei.
